action.action-desc: Mr. Cruz (for himself, Mr. Young, and Mrs. Blackburn) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations

form.official-title: To permit visiting dignitaries and service members from Taiwan to display the flag of the Republic of China.

section.header: Requirement to permit dignitaries and service members from Taiwan to display the flag of the Republic of China

subsection.text: The Secretary of State and the Secretary of Defense shall permit members of the Armed Forces and Government representatives from the Republic of China (Taiwan) or the Taipei Economic and Cultural Representative Office (TECRO) to display, for the official purposes set forth in subsection (b), symbols of Republic of China sovereignty, including—

paragraph.text: the flag of the Republic of China (Taiwan); and
the corresponding emblems or insignia of military units.

subsection.text: The official purposes referred to in subsection (a) are—

paragraph.text: conducting government hosted ceremonies or functions; and
appearances on Department of State and Department of Defense social media accounts promoting engagements with Taiwan.
